DESCRIPTION: Performs a bitwise shift-left, no-rotation operation.
EXAMPLE: <h3>BitSHLN Example</h3> <p>Returns the number, bitwise shifted, without rotation, to the left by count bits.</p> <p>BitSHLN(1,1): <cfoutput>#BitSHLN(1,1)#</cfoutput></p> <p>BitSHLN(1,30): <cfoutput>#BitSHLN(1,30)#</cfoutput></p> <p>BitSHLN(1,31): <cfoutput>#BitSHLN(1,31)#</cfoutput></p> <p>BitSHLN(2,31): <cfoutput>#BitSHLN(2,31)#</cfoutput></p>
USAGE: Bit functions operate on 32-bit signed integers, in the range -2147483648 â€“ 2147483647.

Parameter.DESCRIPTION: Integer, in the range 0-31, inclusive; number of bits to shift the number
